Author: staunch
Content:
I can't think of any silly comments from my code right now, but I have a new one for you :-)

  # ...your computer really doesn't care if you seperate the password from the nonce with a dash; it's a computer, not a 2nd grade teacher[1]
  echo 'MD5(): ' . md5(date('ymdHis', time()) . 'password-is-yummy-salty-safety-' . $pw);
1. http://www.matasano.com/log/958/enough-with-the-rainbow-tabl...

Author: DarrenStuart
Title: YC Dashboard widget
Content: I couldn't find a YC hacker news widget for dashboard so I knocked this one up in dashcode. Let me know what you think. Hope someone finds it useful  :p

Author: terpua
Title: Did Alexander Graham Bell Steal Phone Technology?

Author: burcak
Content:
"Knowing that risk is on average proportionate to reward, investors like risky strategies, while founders, who don't have a big enough sample size to care what's true on average, tend to be more conservative."

I don't think that's the only reason founders want to keep risk low.

The most important reason is that money has diminishing effect on happiness. People want to be able to guarantee a "moderate" life. What comes beyond that is not as important basic needs.

Content: Out of curiosity, did you consider Quickbooks (the business edition)? Or is the structure/funding of your startup very peculiar?
